item.title: TSMC to Inject $10 Billion Capital to Unit to Counter FX Swings
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. is set to inject $10 billion in capital to its overseas unit to shore up its currency hedging operations, its biggest such move to counter a volatile local exchange rate.
item.dc:creator: Cindy Wang, Betty Hou

media:content.media:description: The Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) logo at the company's campus in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Photographer: An Rong Xu/Bloomberg

item.title: AT&T Bets Big on Fiber-Optic Lines in Fight for Internet Traffic
item.description: AT&T Inc. executives made the case for giving up on copper landlines and investing in fiber-optic cable on Bloomberg TV’s Chief Future Officer.
item.dc:creator: Kelcee Griffis, Lisa Abramowicz

media:content.media:description: AT&T Inc. signage is displayed on a store in San Francisco, California, US.

item.title: SoftBank Backs Startup Building Giant Floating Climate Stations
item.description: A startup building massive, bullet-shaped helium balloons that float in the stratosphere has raised $15 million from Japan’s SoftBank Corp. — part of an effort to monitor climate data and bring connectivity to hard-to-reach areas.
item.dc:creator: Brunella Tipismana Urbano

media:content.media:description: New Mexico-based Sceye is building high-altitude platform stations, designed to provide environmental monitoring and connectivity.

item.title: Bolt’s Breslow Is Back With a $600 Million Pitch to Investors
item.description: Ryan Breslow, the chief executive officer of one-click checkout company Bolt Financial Inc., is back with a fresh pitch to investors — seeking to raise $600 million, according to people familiar with the matter. Previous attempts by Breslow to raise cash hit roadblocks.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof, Lizette Chapman

media:content.media:description: DETROIT, MICHIGAN - OCTOBER 04: Ryan Breslow attends the 2022 Forbes 30 Under 30 Summit at Detroit Opera House on October 04, 2022 in Detroit, Michigan. (Photo by Taylor Hill/Getty Images)

item.title: British Man Charged by US in ‘IntelBroker’ Company Data Hacks
item.description: A 25-year-old British man known as “IntelBroker” was accused by US authorities of conspiring with a group of hackers to steal data from dozens of companies and offer it for sale online, causing more than $25 million in damages to victims around the world.
item.dc:creator: Chris Dolmetsch

item.title: Micron Forecast Draws Muted Response Following 2025 Stock Rally
item.description: Micron Technology Inc., Wall Street’s favorite chipmaker this year, delivered an outlook that wasn’t quite rosy enough to keep its 2025 rally going.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

item.title: China’s Xiaomi to Launch First SUV as Shares Near Record High
item.description: The unveiling of Xiaomi Corp.’s first electric SUV on Thursday will showcase how the Chinese tech company has become an investor darling with its high-stakes bet on the auto market.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: Xiaomi YU7 Photographer: CFOTO/Future Publishing/Getty Images

item.title: Vista Raises $5.6 Billion for Cloud Software Continuation Fund
item.description: Vista Equity Partners gathered $5.6 billion in order to keep Cloud Software Group for longer, tapping its own buyout funds and new investors to seal a blockbuster single-asset continuation fund, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Allison McNeely, Laura Benitez, Preeti Singh

media:content.media:description: Citrix headquarters in Santa Clara, California.

item.title: Nvidia Shares Hit a New High to Reclaim World's Largest Stock Record
item.description: Nvidia Corp. shares rose to an all-time high on Wednesday, with the leader in artificial intelligence chips extending an advance that has cemented its position as one of the most valuable companies in the world.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: Startup Backed by Reebok Co-Founder to Design Shoes in Space
item.description: A footwear startup is teaming up with two space companies to design a shoe in orbit as part of a mission to make artificial intelligence and blockchain less expensive and more eco-friendly than it is on Earth.
item.dc:creator: Melos Ambaye

media:content.media:description: A mock-up of a Syntilay shoe designed in space. Source: Syntilay

item.title: Kalshi Hits $2 Billion Valuation in Paradigm-Led Deal
item.description: Kalshi Inc., a prediction market that competes with Polymarket, said it has raised $185 million at a valuation of $2 billion. Paradigm, a venture capital firm focused on cryptocurrency investments, is leading the deal.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: The Kalshi logo arranged on a smartphone in New York, US, on Monday, Feb. 10, 2025. The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is asking Crypto.com and Kalshi Inc. to explain how their recently launched Super Bowl event contracts comply with derivatives regulations. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Micron Faces Earnings Test After Share Price Doubled Since April
item.description: Investors looking for new ways to bet on artificial intelligence infrastructure have been piling into an old but often overlooked name: Micron Technology Inc.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke

item.title: Terra Quantum CEO in Spat With Investor Lakestar Amid Fundraising Talks
item.description: Terra Quantum AG Chief Executive Officer Markus Pflitsch’s relationship with investor Lakestar Capital Partners is deteriorating as the Swiss quantum computing startup seeks a fresh round of funding, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Paula Doenecke, Allegra Catelli

media:content.media:description: Markus Pflitsch, CEO and Founder of Terra Quantum

item.title: SpaceX Polluted Border Area, Mexican President Sheinbaum Says
item.description: SpaceX’s Starship rocket launches in Texas have polluted an area across the border with debris, Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said.
item.dc:creator: Michael O'Boyle

media:content.media:description: TOPSHOT - The SpaceX Starship rocket launches from Starbase, Texas, as seen from South Padre Island on May 27, 2025. SpaceX mission control lost contact with the upper stage of Starship as it leaked fuel, spun out of control, and made an uncontrolled reentry after flying halfway around the world, likely disintegrating over the Indian Ocean, officials said. (Photo by Sergio FLORES / AFP) (Photo by SERGIO FLORES/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: The Big Differences Between Stuxnet and the US Airstrikes in Iran
item.dc:creator: Margi Murphy, Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Iran’s Natanz nuclear-fuel production site, in a satellite imag released on June 17. Source: Planet Labs PBC

item.title: Prosus CEO Bloisi Aims to Double Revenue in Next Three Years
item.description: Technology investor Prosus NV targets to double its revenue over the next three years as the company focuses on building out large lifestyle e-commerce platforms, Chief Executive Officer Fabricio Bloisi said during its capital markets day on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: Fabricio Bloisi

item.title: Cyberattack on UK Health Firm Contributed to Patient Death
item.description: A cyberattack that caused disruption at hospitals in London last year contributed to the death of a patient, health officials have confirmed for the first time.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gallagher

media:content.media:description: HIGH WYCOMBE, ENGLAND - MARCH 13: Details of the National Health Service are seen on the side of an emergency ambulance on March 13, 2025 in High Wycombe, England. The prime minister announced today that NHS England, an executive non-departmental public body created in 2013 to oversee and support the wider NHS, will be folded into the Department of Health within the next two years. (Photo by Ben Montgomery/Getty Images)

item.title: Apple Set to Offer App Store Changes After €500 Million Fine
item.description: Apple Inc. is poised to offer further App Store changes to appease European Union antitrust watchdogs who issued an ultimatum after doling out a €500 million ($580 million) fine.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Stolton

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app.

item.title: Congo Signs Digital-Identification Deal With Singapore’s Trident
item.description: Democratic Republic of Congo signed an agreement with Trident Digital Tech Holdings Ltd. of Singapore to develop a national digital identity and e-government system.
item.dc:creator: Michael J Kavanagh

media:content.media:description: Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo

item.title: Nvidia Can Reach $6 Trillion Market Cap on AI Growth, Loop Says
item.description: The artificial intelligence tailwinds that have driven the shares of Nvidia Corp. sharply higher the past few years show no signs of abating, and could eventually push the chipmaker’s value to a market-topping $6 trillion, according to Loop Capital.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

item.title: Bumble Announces 30% Job Cuts as It Raises Quarterly Outlook
item.description: Bumble Inc. said it’s cutting almost one-third of its staff, months after founder Whitney Wolfe Herd returned as chief executive officer to overhaul the struggling dating app.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: The Bumble logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Monday, Nov. 6, 2023. Bumble Inc. released earnings figures on November 7. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Klarna Founder’s VC Firm Pledges €300 Million Investment in AI
item.description: Swedish impact investor Norrsken VC has pledged to invest €300 million ($348 million) in artificial intelligence startups that aim to help solve some of the climate’s most pressing needs.
item.dc:creator: Lydia Lothman

media:content.media:description: Co-Founder of Klarna Niklas Adalberth

item.title: Google Debuts Gemini AI Coding Tool in Bid to Entice Developers
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google is adding an artificial intelligence coding assistant to to ease the work of developers, aiming to catch up with rival products such as OpenAI’s Codex and Anthropic’s Claude Code.
item.dc:creator: Brunella Tipismana Urbano

media:content.media:description: The Gemini logo on a laptop computer.

item.title: Vodafone Idea Aims for $2.9 Billion in Loans to Bolster Network
item.description: Vodafone Idea Ltd. is talking to lenders to borrow about 250 billion rupees ($2.9 billion) in loans to bolster its network and compete better with large rivals, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Sanjai P R, Baiju Kalesh, Saikat Das

media:content.media:description: Signage for Vodafone Idea Ltd. in Mumbai. Photographer: Dhiraj Singh/Bloomberg

item.title: Promises to Spend Billions on US Chip Revival Still Depend on a Fickle Market
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King reports on the promises from chipmakers to spend money on manufacturing plants in the US.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: A new section of the Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) fabrication plant under construction in Phoenix, Arizona, US, on Monday, March 3, 2025. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., the world’s top producer of AI chips, plans to invest an additional $100 billion in US plants that will boost its chip output on American soil and support President Donald Trump’s goal of increasing domestic manufacturing.

item.title: Tencent Adding Supercell’s Biggest Hits to WeChat Mini Games
item.description: Tencent Holdings Ltd. is converting some of the world’s most popular mobile games into WeChat mini games.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: Brawl Stars Source: Google Play

item.title: Ferrari Branches Out Into Sailing With Engine-Free Racing Yacht
item.description: Ferrari NV unveiled a prototype racing yacht that will hit the ocean next year as the supercar maker branches out into sailing.
item.dc:creator: Daniele Lepido

media:content.media:description: Ferrari’s prototype racing yacht.

item.title: Satellite Firm Capturing US Strikes on Iran Launches AI Service
item.description: In the days after President Donald Trump announced the US had “completely and totally obliterated” nuclear sites in Iran, a Colorado company was able to show some damage but no conclusive evidence that the attack breached the most heavily protected underground facilities.
item.dc:creator: Sana Pashankar

media:content.media:description: A photo taken by a Maxar satellite showing new airstrike craters at the entrance to Iran’s Fordow fuel enrichment facility.

item.title: Uzbekistan’s Largest Digital Banking Platform Names Board Chairman
item.description: Uzbekistan’s largest digital banking platform named Oliver Hughes, who previously ran Russia’s biggest fintech business, to be chairman of the supervisory board, as the firm aims to ramp up its expansion in Central Asia’s most populous nation.
item.dc:creator: Yuliya Fedorinova

media:content.media:description: Technology

item.title: CATL Prioritizing Overseas Expansion as EV Price War Persists
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., the world’s largest electric vehicle battery maker, is making overseas expansion its “No. 1 priority” as intense competition in China’s domestic car market threatens the industry’s health, according to Chief Manufacturing Officer Ni Jun.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Chunying Zhang, Linda Lew, Stephen Engle

media:content.media:description: CATL branding.
